Summary I am an IBM executive with more than 18 years experience in translating complex ideas and issues into understandable business strategies. I've held several media relations, executive communications and internal communications positions at the company. Currently I lead IBM's global workforce communications and enablement (aka internal communications) for the company -- a role that blends expertise in marketing and communications. Beyond communicating to employees, we drive culture change programs across the company. Our mission is to help IBMers understand our strategy and live up to our corporate character: our purpose, our values are how we engage and show up as IBMers in front of all the people we care about. In other words, how IBM is actually experienced by clients, investors, partners, fellow IBMers and individuals in the communities we live and operate in. Summary Jessica draws on a background of more than 10 years of professional experience practicing communications and media relations in New Zealand, Australia and the United Kingdom. She has worked for a number of large corporations and public relations agencies, including IBM, IAG, Ernst & Young and Citigate Dewe Rogerson. 
 
Jessica's most recent experience is four years with IBM. During this time she managed the external relations for IBM Global Business Services in Australia and New Zealand. This included securing and preparing for high visibility media, analyst and speaking engagements. She also worked closely with the managing director to develop her executive profile and brand affinity in New Zealand. This resulted in her being featured in a number of interviews with print, electronic and broadcast media. 
 
Jessica's experience includes developing and driving thought leadership PR campaigns to address specific challenges with external audiences. One such campaign was recognised by the Public Relations Institute of Australia (PRIA) receiving a best in category award for B2B marketing. Another campaign was recognised by the New Zealand Marketing Association (NZMA) receiving a finalist award for B2B marketing. 
 
Jessica’s experience includes business and technology, corporate, financial and professional services sectors. 
 
Jessica holds a Graduate Diploma in Business Studies (Communication Management) from Massey University.
